Content.Name: AFY Counselor Information
Content.Title: AFY Position Information
Content.Abstract: Want to be an AFY Counselor? Read the instructions on this page and fill out an application. We started accepting applications for AFY staff openings January 11, 2012.
Content.BodyCopy:
Thank you for your interest in becoming an AFY Counselor. We are no longer accepting applications for the summer of 2012. Please check the website next January 2013 for summer employment.

The purpose of Adventure For Youth (AFY) is to encourage youth to draw closer to the Savior by acting on true principles, participating in adventure activities, and seeking an excellent balance in all things.

AFY seeks to achieve this balance through:

  1. Participating in gospel centered devotionals & discussions
  2. Gathering youth that share common values
  3. Challenging activities and events
  4. Encouraging social and service interaction
  5. Developing learning skills through preparing, teaching, and pondering principles

The success of Adventure For Youth is dependant upon its staff to catch the vision of the mission of AFY and share that vision with the youth. If you are committed to serving youth, please apply for one of the positions below.

AFY Staff Positions

There are two staff postions available for AFY.

  • AFY Coordinator
  • AFY Counselor

Application Information
Please apply by sending all application materials to Community Connections at BYU-Idaho. Download and follow the instructions for the AFY application. Only applicants that have turned in a cover letter, resume, application, two reference letters, and two letters of recommendation will be considered for interviews.
We will start accepting applications for AFY staff openings beginning January 11, 2012.

AFY Counselor

Job Duties/Skills
Understand and share vision of AFY program with youth. Supervise and guide a group of youth each week. Prepare nightly devotionals. Provide an example of enthusiastic obedience.  Model a disciple-like life. Incorporate the gospel principles and use the learning model during teaching moments.  Keep an energetic, positive attitude for all activities.

Requirements
Applicant must be able to work well with youth and must be in good standing both in the community and church. Applicant must be social as well as a leader.  Applicant must also be physically fit and able to participate in adventure type activities. (See AFY Counselor Information Sheet for more details.)

Preparation Phase (June 4 - June 8)

  • Training phase will include the full AFY experience and training

Program Phase (June 11 through  August 3)

  • Program includes white water rafting, ropes course, temple baptisms, devotionals, games and dances.
  • Work hours are 7 a.m. to 11 p.m. Monday - Friday
  • Compensation will be $320 per week

AFY Coordinator

Job Duties/Skills
Coordinate and facilitate daily activities of AFY. Assist director in planning events. Provide leadership teaching to counselors. Direct meetings and provide devotionals. Build excitement and AFY brand through program activities. Implement risk management techniques. Enforce "Lights Out" Policy. Capture and share vision of AFY with counselors and participants. Ensure that event's objectives are clearly carried out

Requirements
Previous work experience with youth programming or counseling. Must be able to work long hours and be of supurb spiritual, mental and physical health. Coordinator must be experienced in leading and teaching. Applicant must have references available and be in good standing with the church. (See AFY Coordinator Information Sheet for more details.)

Preparation Phase (May 27 - June 8)

  • Assist planning and mapping out AFY summer program
  • Prepare all aspects of AFY youth program and counselor training
  • Provide full AFY experience and training for counselors

Program Phase (June 11 through  August 3)

  • Program duties include set up and take down of all activities
  • Counselor training and advising
  • Work hours vary but include 7 a.m. to 11:30 p.m. Monday - Friday
  • Compensation will be $350 per week
